messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Canadian TV
messages.msgSnippet: That s hilarious!!! I WONDERED what niggin was! When I signed on with our community food pantry, I was assigned the position of food pantry coordinator . So
messages.messageBody:
That's hilarious!!! I WONDERED what 'niggin' was! When I signed on with our community food pantry, I was assigned the position of 'food pantry coordinator'. So being the excited, anxious do/gooder that I am, I quickly jotted off an email to everyone on the list telling them that I was the new ' food panty coordinator'. Yep! You read that right. I accidentally put 'panty' instead of 'pantry' and naturally spellcheck didn't pick it up! Of course, I didn't realize that I had done this until patrons starting coming in the library ( where I was the librarian) to ask if I was the new 'food panty coordinator'! Don't you just LOVE those typos! Mary in Va.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Canadian TV
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/4/02 2:46:40 PM Central Daylight Time, ...  I do believe you mean Noggin. ;o) And yeah, that is a good station too. We don t watch
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/4/02 2:46:40 PM Central Daylight Time,
KathrynJB@... writes:


> We've been watching a lot of Niggin in the evenings.

<BWG> I do believe you mean Noggin. ;o) And yeah, that is a good station too.
We don't watch it too much in the evenings, (too many things for teens that
mine aren't interested in yet.) but we do like many of the programs.
~Nancy

messages.subject: Re: Canadian TV
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/4/2002 1:39:40 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... We ve been watching a lot of Niggin in the evenings. Julian is enjoying the vicarious thrill
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/4/2002 1:39:40 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> It is a TV station, we get it on satellite. I think it might be out of
> Canada, but could be very wrong. Speaking of Canada, I have noticed that a
> lot of programs Moly likes to watch come from there. She loves the station
> Discovery Kids, and many (all?) programs on that station come from Canada.
> Another show called The Worst Witch, airs on HBOF and it too comes from
> Canada. My point? I guess that I really appreciate the quality programs for
>
> kids that come from Canada, it seems like they take care in what they
> produce
> for children.
>

We've been watching a lot of Niggin in the evenings. Julian is enjoying the
vicarious thrill of watching Degrassi Jr. High (Beth and I are too) and 24/7,
both about teens in school, one in Canada, one in England. Neither has any
impact on his wanting to go to school, but it's fun anyway. (They also run
Daria, which we all love.)

Degrassi (it's a new one, based on the one that ran a while ago, with some
same characters) is interesting. They cover issues never done here in a cool
way, like teens and sexuality, etc.

Kathryn
